alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 2:55PM AKST until December 24 at 1:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKST THIS EVENING THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKST SATURDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions and very cold wind chills. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as 1/4 mile in blowing snow. There will not be any new snow for this event, just blowing around of existing snow on the ground. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 8 PM AKST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 1 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact travel on area roadways due to the reduced visibility and drifting of snow. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds have peaked and started to diminish. Expect a continued diminishing trend in winds through tonight, leading so slowly improving conditions through Thompson Pass. The coldest wind chill values are expected tonight through saturday morning.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
